reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: SASK strengthens human rights in the world of work through the global south?s trade union movement in Africa Asia and Latin America. In doing so SASK and its partners promote fairer social development the realization of Agenda 2030 and Finland's developmen t policy goals.The approach of the programme is an actor-based theory of change according to which SASK seeks to bring about changes in the operational capacity of partners and thereby improvements in the realization of workers' human rights and the reduct ion of poverty and inequality. The long-term development goal of SASK's programme is that by 2030 the rights of workers of all genders in SASK's programme countries are realized clearly better than before and the countries are fulfilling the objectives of ILO conventions and Finland?s development policy in promoting the conventions.SASK's means of achieving goals are to increase the partners' competence and operational capacity through project cooperation exchange of experts mentoring networking and labor m arket-related research. In Finland the means are communication global education with its voluntary networks and advocacy work the target group being primarily the active rank-and-file members of Finnish trade unions and people in decision-making positions. Beneficiaries and key rights-holders are workers from the global south and their communities in the programme countries estimated at 35 million people. The dutybearers are government decision-makers and officials. An estimated 350000 to 375000 people take part in the programme's activities each year and they become aware of their human rights in the world of work and as members of trade unions promote decent work and inclusive economic growth.SASK's partners are trade unions operating in the global south th e international TU movement network its affiliates and Finnish civil society organisations. The programme's results-based management and risk management systems are comprehensive and holistic. The results generated and potential risks are assessed annually at different levels of the result chain and the implementation is monitored using indicators in the result framework throughout the programme period.

tag.narrative: Generating jobs, livelihood opportunities and well-being in a developing country is the main prio rity area in this activity
Improving democracy in societies is a secondary priority area in this activity
Strengthening of the rights and status of women and girls is a secondary priority area in this activity
